page.title: 16At school in Hazelbury Bryan
page.content: Most of the pupils who attend Hazelbury Bryan School travel by school bus or car each morning and arrive at 8.45a.m. because their houses are scattered over a 15 square mile area. At 9.05 a bell is rung and we line up. Classes are split into work groups so that each has to follow a daily timetable which is usualy written on the board. We work at some form of mathematics and English in the mornings, with science and topics. The afternoons are for craft, games, and art. We swop teachers for music. There are breaks in the afternoon for play, and dinner time is one hour for the juniors and one and a half for the infants. At 3.30pm the school bus sets off on its tour around the area and the school day ends.
